title: How to Make Treacle Scones

steps.headline: Combine the flour, salt, baking soda, spice and sugar in a large bowl.

text: Preheat the oven to 220ºC/425ºF.  Combine the flour, salt, baking soda, spice and sugar in a large bowl.  Rub the butter in until it resembles fine breadcrumbs.  Pour in the black treacle and stir through gradually, pouring in the milk at the same time. Mix thoroughly until a soft dough forms. Flour a work area or a board. Roll the dough out to an even thickness, about  2.5cm/1" width. Use a scone cutter or the mouth of a glass to make rounds from the dough. Keep reshaping the dough until it is no longer possible to get any more rounds. Place the rounds on a baking tray lined with baking paper.  Brush with an egg glaze if wished. This will give a shiny result but is not essential. Place the tray in the oven and bake for 15 - 20 minutes. The scones are ready when they are firm to touch and have approximately doubled in height. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.  Serve warm. Butter, jam and cream, or just plain are all suitable options.
